result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald D. Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant's bond shall be applied towards the costs and the unpaid costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning June 15, 2017.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald D. Hart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Ronald D. Hart - Payment Plan Due Date Summary and Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order - "not deliverable as addressed"
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Ronald D. Hart in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to the charge.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Statement by attorney Nocco.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  Bond to be applied.  Balance to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning June 15, 2017.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ronald D. Hart in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco by phone.  Defendant Ronald D. Hart in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty by phone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $100.00 cash bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.  Court ordered bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Alec Phillip Nocco in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nocco states to court that he has no explaination for DE nonappearance.  Court orders a body only bench warrant. ba

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Ronald D. Hart in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nocco waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Court orders $500.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2017 at 03:45 pm.  - rt
